--- | --- | --- | --- | | Hydrogen | 1.0079 | H | 1 | keyboard\_arrow\_down | | 1
H
Hydrogen
1.0079
Hydrogen is a chemical element with symbol H and atomic number 1. With a standard
atomic weight of 1.008, hydrogen is the lightest element on the periodic table. \-\- Wikipedia | | Helium | 4.0026 | He | 2 | keyboard\_arrow\_down | | 2
He
Helium
4.0026
Helium is a chemical element with symbol He and atomic number 2. It is a
colorless, odorless, tasteless, non-toxic, inert, monatomic gas, the first in the noble gas
group in the periodic table. Its boiling point is the lowest among all the elements. \-\- Wikipedia | | Lithium | 6.941 | Li | 3 | keyboard\_arrow\_down | | 3
Li
Lithium
6.941
Lithium is a chemical element with symbol Li and atomic number 3. It is a soft,
silvery-white alkali metal. Under standard conditions, it is the lightest metal and the
lightest solid element. \-\- Wikipedia | | Beryllium | 9.0122 | Be | 4 | keyboard\_arrow\_down | | 4
Be
Beryllium
9.0122
Beryllium is a chemical element with symbol Be and atomic number 4. It is a
relatively rare element in the universe, usually occurring as a product of the spallation of
larger atomic nuclei that have collided with cosmic rays. \-\- Wikipedia | | Boron | 10.811 | B | 5 | keyboard\_arrow\_down | | 5
B
Boron
10.811
Boron is a chemical element with symbol B and atomic number 5. Produced entirely
by cosmic ray spallation and supernovae and not by stellar nucleosynthesis, it is a
low-abundance element in the Solar system and in the Earth's crust. \-\- Wikipedia | | Carbon | 12.0107 | C | 6 | keyboard\_arrow\_down | | 6
C
Carbon
12.0107
Carbon is a chemical element with symbol C and atomic number 6. It is nonmetallic
and tetravalentâ€”making four electrons available to form covalent chemical bonds. It belongs
to group 14 of the periodic table. \-\- Wikipedia | | Nitrogen | 14.0067 | N | 7 | keyboard\_arrow\_down | | 7
N
Nitrogen
14.0067
Nitrogen is a chemical element with symbol N and atomic number 7. It was first
discovered and isolated by Scottish physician Daniel Rutherford in 1772. \-\- Wikipedia | | Oxygen | 15.9994 | O | 8 | keyboard\_arrow\_down | | 8
O
Oxygen
15.9994
Oxygen is a chemical element with symbol O and atomic number 8. It is a member of
the chalcogen group on the periodic table, a highly reactive nonmetal, and an oxidizing
agent that readily forms oxides with most elements as well as with other compounds. \-\- Wikipedia | | Fluorine | 18.9984 | F | 9 | keyboard\_arrow\_down | | 9
F
Fluorine
18.9984
Fluorine is a chemical element with symbol F and atomic number 9. It is the
lightest halogen and exists as a highly toxic pale yellow diatomic gas at standard
conditions. \-\- Wikipedia | | Neon | 20.1797 | Ne | 10 | keyboard\_arrow\_down | | 10
Ne
Neon
20.1797
Neon is a chemical element with symbol Ne and atomic number 10. It is a noble gas.
Neon is a colorless, odorless, inert monatomic gas under standard conditions, with about
two-thirds the density of air. \-\- Wikipedia | Table with filtering linkcodeopen\_in\_new Filter | No. | Name | Weight | Symbol | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | 1 | Hydrogen | 1.0079 | H | | 2 | Helium | 4.0026 | He | | 3 | Lithium | 6.941 | Li | | 4 | Beryllium | 9.0122 | Be | | 5 | Boron | 10.811 | B | | 6 | Carbon | 12.0107 | C | | 7 | Nitrogen | 14.0067 | N | | 8 | Oxygen | 15.9994 | O | | 9 | Fluorine | 18.9984 | F | | 10 | Neon | 20.1797 | Ne | Basic use of \`\` (uses display flex) linkcodeopen\_in\_new No. Name Weight Symbol 1 Hydrogen 1.0079 H 2 Helium 4.0026 He 3 Lithium 6.941 Li 4 Beryllium 9.0122 Be 5 Boron 10.811 B 6 Carbon 12.0107 C 7 Nitrogen 14.0067 N 8 Oxygen 15.9994 O 9 Fluorine 18.9984 F 10 Neon 20.1797 Ne Flex table where one column's cells has a greater height than others. linkcodeopen\_in\_new No. Name Weight Symbol 1 Hydrogen 1.0079 H 2 Helium 4.0026 He 3 Lithium 6.941 Li 4 Beryllium 9.0122 Be 5 Boron 10.811 B 6 Carbon 12.0107 C 7 Nitrogen 14.0067 N 8 Oxygen 15.9994 O 9 Fluorine 18.9984 F 10 Neon 20.1797 Ne Footer row table linkcodeopen\_in\_new | Item | Cost | | --- | --- | | Beach ball | $4.00 | | Towel | $5.00 | | Frisbee | $2.00 | | Sunscreen | $4.00 | | Cooler | $25.00 | | Swim suit | $15.00 | | Total | $55.00 | Table with columns defined using a for loop instead of statically written in the template. linkcodeopen\_in\_new | No. | Name | Weight | Symbol | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | 1 | Hydrogen | 1.0079 | H | | 2 | Helium | 4.0026 | He | | 3 | Lithium | 6.941 | Li | | 4 | Beryllium | 9.0122 | Be | | 5 | Boron | 10.811 | B | | 6 | Carbon | 12.0107 | C | | 7 | Nitrogen | 14.0067 | N | | 8 | Oxygen | 15.9994 | O | | 9 | Fluorine | 18.9984 | F | | 10 | Neon | 20.1797 | Ne | Testing with MatTableHarness linkcodeopen\_in\_new This example contains tests.
